en: American politics are interesting to watch, especially during a presidential election.
ko: 미국 정치는 특히 대선 기간에 보면 진짜 흥미로워.

en: Is American food popular here in Japan?
Slaves are brought to the American colonies.
Compared with those in America, Japanese marriages rarely end in divorce.
ko: 미국에 비하면 일본 부부들은 이혼을 거의 안 해.

en: American women didn't have the right to vote.
U.S. revisionists take a hard-line approach to Japanese relations.
ko: 미국 수정주의자들은 대일 관계에서 강경한 입장을 취해.

en: What is the capital of the United States?
American children grow up hearing those words.
ko: 미국 아이들은 그런 말을 들으면서 자라.

en: I don't think I can cut in working in America.
ko: 미국에서 일하며 버텨낼 수 없을 것 같아.

en: American industry makes various attempts to find and encourage brilliant students from abroad.
ko: 미국 산업계는 해외의 우수한 학생들을 발굴하고 장려하려고 다양한 시도를 해.

en: Black people in America once said, "Give us freedom".
ko: 미국의 흑인들은 한때 "우리에게 자유를 달라"고 말했어.

en: The American people elected Mr. Clinton President.
Many American high-school students do not know that the Civil War took place between 1861 and 1865.
ko: 많은 미국 고등학생들이 남북전쟁이 1861년에서 1865년 사이에 일어났다는 걸 몰라.

en: The American police are in blue uniforms.
U.S. companies are working to find a niche in the Japanese economy.
ko: 미국 기업들은 일본 경제에서 틈새시장을 찾으려고 노력 중이야.

en: American students are falling behind in math.
Many American students work their way through the university.
ko: 많은 미국 대학생들이 아르바이트를 하며 학교를 다녀.

en: Athletic boys are popular with girls in American schools.
ko: 미국 학교에서는 운동 잘하는 남자애들이 인기가 많아.

en: I've made up my mind to work for a company in the States.
American songs were on the air.
The American home does away with most housework by using machines.
ko: 미국 가정에서는 기계를 써서 집안일 대부분을 해결해.

en: It was dark in the American house.
How does America impress you?
I saw an American musical.
In U.S. bakeries, a "baker's dozen" is 13, not 12.
American news stories always refer to "The Japanese" no matter who is being talked about.
ko: 미국 뉴스는 누구에 대해 얘기하든 항상 '일본인들'이라고 지칭해.

en: American senior citizens are comparatively well-off.
ko: 미국 노인들은 비교적 여유 있게 살아.

en: If you decide to come to America, please let me know as soon as possible.
ko: 미국에 오기로 결정하면 최대한 빨리 알려줘.

en: I wonder what has become of him after he went to America.
ko: 그 사람 미국 가더니 어떻게 됐는지 궁금해.

en: You have to cross the ocean to get to America.
He told me he was going to America.
ko: 그 사람은 미국에 갈 거라고 말했어.

en: There are many races in the United States.
America has an elaborate system of constitutional checks and balances.
ko: 미국은 헌법상 견제와 균형 시스템이 정교하게 짜여 있어.

en: Several races live together in America.
There are fifty states in America.
Laws to prevent computer crimes were enacted in the USA.
ko: 미국에서는 컴퓨터 범죄를 막기 위한 법이 제정됐어.

en: I had many problems during my visit to the U.S., but overall, I had a good time.
ko: 미국 방문 중에 고생도 좀 했지만, 전반적으로는 즐거웠어.

en: It would have been better if you had stayed in America.
ko: 네가 그냥 미국에 있었으면 더 좋았을 텐데.

en: I want to stay in America for a few years.
ko: 미국에서 몇 년 동안 지내고 싶어.

en: In America, rice can be bought for a fifth of what it costs in Japan.
ko: 미국에서는 쌀을 일본 가격의 5분의 1 정도로 살 수 있어.

en: The joint-venture between the American and Japanese companies fell through.
ko: 미국 기업과 일본 기업의 합작 투자가 무산됐어.

en: I'm looking forward to touring bookstores in the US.
ko: 미국 서점들을 구경 다니는 게 너무 기대돼.

en: In America cars drive on the right side of the road.
What is the most popular sport in America?
ko: 미국에서 제일 인기 있는 스포츠가 뭐야?

en: In America, scores of free agents switch teams every year.
ko: 미국에서는 매년 수많은 자유계약 선수들이 팀을 옮겨.

en: In the U.S., it is common to give a present, such as glasses or a coffee-maker, to the bride at weddings.
ko: 미국에서는 결혼식 때 신부에게 컵이나 커피메이커 같은 선물을 주는 게 흔해.

en: In the U.S., part of the application process to universities usually includes an essay on "Why I want to go to university."
ko: 미국 대학 입시 과정에는 보통 "왜 대학에 가고 싶은가"에 대한 에세이가 포함돼.

en: Many couples in America both work to make ends meet.
ko: 미국에는 생계를 꾸리기 위해 맞벌이하는 부부가 많아.

en: In America, many people have fences around their homes.
ko: 미국에서는 집 주변에 울타리를 친 사람들이 많아.

en: In the U.S., freedom of religion is one of the guarantees of the Bill of Rights.
ko: 미국에서 종교의 자유는 권리 장전이 보장하는 권리 중 하나예요.

en: In the United States it is popular for girls to learn to skip rope.
ko: 미국에서는 여자애들이 줄넘기 배우는 게 인기가 많아요.

en: Laws differ from state to state in the United States.
In the U.S., you usually have to show identification in order to buy alcohol.
ko: 미국에서 술 살 때는 보통 신분증을 보여줘야 돼요.

en: In the United States the automobile is a necessity and not a luxury.
There are still some dry states in the U.S.
ko: 미국에는 아직도 술 판매가 금지된 주들이 좀 있어요.

en: They speak English in America.
In the U.S. I was often taken to be Chinese.
ko: 미국에 있을 때 중국인으로 오해받는 일이 많았어요.

en: Bean sprouts are eaten as a salad in America.
In the U.S., most people can vote when they reach eighteen years of age.
ko: 미국에서는 대부분 만 18세가 되면 투표를 할 수 있어요.

en: No sport is as popular as football in America.
ko: 미국에서 풋볼만큼 인기 있는 스포츠는 없어요.

en: There are a great many forest fires in America.
Where are you going to stay in the States?
In American money, a "quarter" is 25 cents; 4 quarters make a dollar.
In America elderly people are not given the same degree of respect they receive in many other countries.
ko: 미국에서 어르신들은 다른 나라들만큼 대우를 받지는 못해요.

en: In the U.S., there are more prisoners than there is jail space for them. So the prisons are overcrowded.
ko: 미국은 수감자 수에 비해 교도소가 부족해서 항상 꽉 차 있어요.

en: While some private and church schools in America have uniforms, they are not common.
ko: 미국 사립학교나 종교 학교 중에는 교복을 입는 곳도 있지만 흔하진 않아요.

en: In America, my schedule is different and unique nearly every day.
ko: 미국에서의 제 일정은 거의 매일매일이 다르고 특별해요.

en: In the U.S., it is common for people to write a check instead of paying cash.
ko: 미국에서는 현금 대신 수표를 쓰는 게 흔해요.

en: In the United States, 20 million new jobs have been created during the past two decades, most of them in the service sector.
ko: 미국에서는 지난 20년 동안 2천만 개의 일자리가 생겼는데, 대부분 서비스업이에요.

en: In the U.S., you have the option, when you enter a restaurant, to sit in the smoking or non-smoking section.
ko: 미국 식당에 가면 흡연석이나 금연석 중에 골라 앉을 수 있어요.

en: What's your business in the States?
Every town in America has a library.
ko: 미국은 어느 동네에 가나 도서관이 있어요.

en: There are roads and freeways wherever you go in America.
ko: 미국은 어딜 가나 도로랑 고속도로가 잘 되어 있어요.

en: Why do you think soccer isn't popular in the US?
ko: 미국에서 왜 축구가 인기가 없다고 생각하세요?

en: Have you made much progress in English in America?
ko: 미국 가서 영어 실력 많이 늘었어요?

en: A student from America lives near my house.
ko: 우리 집 근처에 미국에서 온 학생이 살아요.

en: I will have graduated from college by the time you come back from America.
ko: 미국에서 돌아오실 때쯤이면 저 대학교 졸업했을 거예요.

en: I'll get in touch with you as soon as I return from America.
We have received many orders from the U.S.
I understand you're visiting from America.
We captured cicadas with a net.
Don't get your dander up, but I have bad news to tell you.
ko: 너무 화내지 마세요, 안 좋은 소식이 좀 있거든요.

en: Don't depend on your parents too much.
It wasn't a very interesting novel.
I hope this will not inconvenience you too much.
Don't work yourself too hard.
I felt so sleepy that I could hardly keep my eyes open.
ko: 너무 졸려서 눈 뜨고 있기가 힘들었어요.

en: Don't take things so seriously.
Don't take things too seriously.
Don't blow your own horn too much.
Don't put much confidence in him.
I don't see much of him.
I hope we don't have to wait for too long.
I had not waited long before he came.
ko: 별로 안 기다렸는데 그 사람이 왔어요.

en: You don't look very well. You had better not go to work today.
ko: 안색이 안 좋아 보여요. 오늘은 출근 안 하는 게 좋겠어요.

en: I am hoarse from yelling so much.
A child is spoiled by too much attention.
ko: 아이들은 관심을 너무 많이 주면 버릇이 나빠져요.

en: I was surprised because it was very big.
I had not waited long before he appeared.
ko: 얼마 안 기다렸는데 그 사람이 나타났어요.

en: He got so stout that his collar did not meet.
ko: 살이 너무 쪄서 목둘레가 안 맞아.

en: Don't expect too much.
Don't be too dependent on others.
I experience nausea when I go on too many rides.
Don't rely too much on others.
Please don't walk too fast.
Don't lean too much on others.
Don't depend on other people too much.
Don't be so serious. It's only a game.
ko: 너무 진지하게 굴지 마, 그냥 게임이야.

en: I don't read newspapers much.
Don't worry too much, or you'll go bald.
ko: 너무 걱정하지 마, 그러다 머리 빠진다.

en: Be sure not to eat too much.
It is too hot to work.
I didn't care about going out.
It is dangerous to drink too much.
ko: 술 너무 많이 마시는 건 위험해.

en: I do not have much time.
I don't have much time. Could you hurry?
ko: 시간이 별로 없으니까 좀 서둘러 줄래?

en: I don't have much time.
Don't be discouraged because you are not very talented.
If you push yourself too hard, you'll make yourself ill.
I would like a less expensive double room.
ko: 좀 더 싼 더블룸으로 하고 싶어.

en: Many a mother spoils her sons by not being strict enough.
ko: 아들을 너무 오냐오냐 키워서 망치는 엄마들이 많아.

en: You don't look so hot.
Not too well.
Don't press your luck, kid.
There is not much hope.
Don't get your hopes up too much.
It seems that you are not having a good time here.
I had not gone far before I met him.
We had not gone far before we were caught in a shower.
I had not gone very far when I was caught in a shower.
ko: 얼마 안 갔을 때 소나기를 만났어.

en: It's too dark to play baseball now.
ko: 지금 너무 어두워서 야구 못 해.

en: I don't watch a lot of movies, but I can't resist a good documentary.
ko: 영화를 많이 보진 않지만, 좋은 다큐멘터리는 꼭 봐.

en: It's too dark to play tennis now.
ko: 지금 너무 어두워서 테니스 못 쳐.

en: I feel tense and agitated when I have too much work to do.
ko: 할 일이 너무 많으면 불안하고 초조해져.

en: She was not a very good pianist.
ko: 그녀는 피아노를 아주 잘 치는 편은 아니었어.

en: Such was her fright that she closed her eyes.
It was so hot that we couldn't walk for long.
ko: 너무 더워서 오래 걸을 수가 없었어.

en: Because I was too busy.
It's so difficult that I've decided to give up trying.
If he is corrected too much, he will stop talking.
ko: 너무 사사건건 지적하면 걔 입 꾹 닫을걸.

en: His muscles ached from sitting too long in one position.
ko: 한 자세로 너무 오래 앉아 있어서 근육이 아팠어.

en: I was worn out because I had to take care of so many children.
ko: 애들을 너무 많이 돌봐야 해서 진이 다 빠졌어.

en: She shut her eyes because the light was so strong.

ko: 너무 급하게 써서 그런지 편지에 실수가 많았어.

en: It's too cold to go to the sea yet.
So friendly was his letter that she was deeply moved and began to cry.
ko: 편지가 너무 다정해서 그녀는 감동받아 울기 시작했어.

en: If there are too many irons in the fire in too short a time, good strategy cannot result.
ko: 너무 짧은 시간에 일을 많이 벌리면 좋은 전략이 안 나와.

en: There was so much noise that the speaker couldn't make himself heard.
ko: 너무 시끄러워서 말하는 소리가 하나도 안 들렸어.

en: It rained so hard that the shrine was washed away.
ko: 비가 너무 많이 와서 사당이 떠내려갔어.

en: So much has happened. It's as if the whole world is flipped upside down.
ko: 별일이 다 있었어. 온 세상이 뒤집힌 것 같아.

en: You have changed so much that I can hardly recognize you.
ko: 너무 많이 변해서 못 알아볼 정도야.

en: Being too nervous to reply, he stared at the floor.
ko: 너무 긴장해서 대답도 못 하고 바닥만 쳐다보더라고.

en: When you rely on the team too much, it may reduce your individual competitive instincts.
ko: 팀에 너무 의지하면 개인의 경쟁심이 떨어질 수 있어.

en: He is apt to get angry if you ask a lot of questions.
ko: 그 사람은 질문을 많이 하면 화를 잘 내는 편이야.

en: Don't boast too much about that.
Holding an eel too fast is the way to let her escape.
ko: 장어를 너무 꽉 잡으려고 하면 오히려 놓치기 쉬워.

en: Only if it's not too much trouble.
I was wondering if you could give me a lift, if it isn't too much trouble.
ko: 번거롭지 않으시다면 차 좀 태워 주실 수 있을까요?

en: You shouldn't eat too much candy.
Don't make the perm too strong, please.
ko: 파마 너무 강하지 않게 해 주세요.

en: Don't spend too much money.
As I do not have enough money, I will have to do without a new coat this winter.
ko: 돈이 없어서 이번 겨울은 새 코트 없이 버텨야겠어.

en: The Amazon is the second longest river in the world after the Nile.
ko: 아마존강은 나일강 다음으로 세계에서 두 번째로 긴 강이야.

en: The Amazon is fed by a large number of tributaries.

There are so-called primitive cultures in the jungles of the Amazon and on the island of New Guinea, and there are so-called advanced cultures in Europe, Asia, and Africa, but the languages of these cultures are all equally advanced and complex.
ko: 아마존 정글이나 뉴기니 섬에는 소위 원시 문화가 있고 유럽, 아시아, 아프리카에는 소위 선진 문화가 있다고들 하지만, 이들의 언어는 모두 똑같이 발달해 있고 복잡해.

en: I asked for an appointment, but he wouldn't spare me the time.
ko: 만나자고 약속을 잡으려 했는데 시간을 안 내주더라고.

en: The Apollo program greatly advanced our knowledge of space.
ko: 아폴로 계획 덕분에 우주에 대한 지식이 엄청나게 늘었어.

en: A report came in that Apollo 11 succeeded in landing on the moon.
ko: 아폴로 11호가 달 착륙에 성공했다는 보고가 들어왔어.

en: The sun was shining in all its splendid beauty.
It isn't surprising that Africans may think of English as one of their continent's languages.
ko: 아프리카 사람들이 영어를 자기 대륙의 언어 중 하나로 생각하는 건 놀라운 일이 아니야.

en: Africa is a continent; Greenland is not.
Africa is a continent, but Greenland is not.
Africa is exporting beef to Europe.
Africa was once called the Dark Continent.
Refugees in Africa are seeking help.
My heart aches for the starving children in Africa.
ko: 아프리카에서 굶주리는 아이들을 보면 마음이 너무 아파.

en: Have you ever been to Africa?
Africa has a lot of nature.
Those who are suffering from hunger in Africa need urgent help.
ko: 아프리카에서 굶주림으로 고통받는 사람들에게는 긴급한 도움이 필요해.

en: My year in Africa was a very educational experience in many ways.
ko: 아프리카에서 보낸 1년은 여러모로 참 유익한 경험이었어.

en: Many people in Africa were killed as a result of the storm.
ko: 폭풍 때문에 아프리카에서 많은 사람이 목숨을 잃었어.

en: A lot of people in Africa go hungry.
Many children die of starvation in Africa.
ko: 아프리카에서 많은 아이가 기아로 죽어가고 있어.

en: They have had no rain in Africa for more than a month.
ko: 아프리카에 한 달 넘게 비가 안 오고 있어.

en: Abraham Lincoln's father was a carpenter by trade.
I don't want to go out on a limb.
They're some developers who aim to make a fast buck!
ko: 단숨에 큰돈을 벌려고 하는 개발자들이 좀 있어!

en: Ducks were swimming about on the pond.
It looks like a duck.
What's a loon?
Can you tell a duck from a goose?
Did you rent an apartment?
We soon agreed on a rent for the apartment.
You don't have to pay for an apartment in advance.
ko: 아파트 비용을 미리 낼 필요는 없어.

en: How much rent do you pay for the apartment?
The flat is on fire.
What have you done with that wristwatch?
The talented young chess player is very bold. He deliberately lays himself open to attack, makes himself vulnerable and then checkmates his opponent when least expected.
ko: 그 재능 있는 젊은 체스 선수는 정말 대담해. 일부러 허점을 보여서 공격을 유도하더니, 상대가 전혀 예상치 못했을 때 외통수를 쳐버리더라고.

en: That story can be true.
The story was a two-faced lie that she told you to make you angry with me.
ko: 그 얘기는 너랑 나랑 사이 틀어지게 하려고 걔가 지어낸 새빨간 거짓말이야.

en: That story is too incredible to be true.
ko: 그 이야기는 사실이라기엔 너무 말도 안 돼.

en: That way of speaking is peculiar to people in this part of the country.
ko: 저 말투는 이 지역 사람들만의 독특한 특징이야.
